subject: Cybersecurity
title: Frequency Analysis: The Codebreaker's Weapon
description: One-minute skill: Frequency Analysis: The Codebreaker's Weapon.

hook.text: In the 9th century, an Arab scholar cracked ciphers by counting which letters appeared most often.

buildup.text: Al-Kindi realized that 'E' is the most common letter in English. In ciphertext, the most common letter is probably 'E'.

discovery.text: Frequency analysis breaks any simple substitution cipher. Language patterns survive encryption.

twist.text: This technique was so effective that cryptographers spent centuries trying to defeat it, driving cipher evolution.

climax.text: Al-Kindi's insight: encrypted text still carries fingerprints of the original language.

punchline.text: Every language has patterns. Patterns are weaknesses.

quiz.question: Who pioneered frequency analysis for breaking ciphers?
